page.title: 09HANLEY PARK
page.content: Hanley Park was designed in l890 by Thomas H Mawson and cost then seventy five thousand pounds to complete.Of one hundred and five acres of pitshafts, spoil heaps and a pottery refuse tip, eighty acres were used for the park.It was opened in l897. Now it is the headquarters of the Parks Department of Stoke-on-Trent which employs six hundred people.It also has swings,a lake,football pitches,tennis courts and a bandstand.It has a great variety of trees,shrubs and plants to create a pleasant environment.The park possesses the biggest crown bowling green in the world measuring seventy by eighty five yards. The creation of this park was the first reclamation scheme undertaken in the Potteries.Nearly a century later the city is reclaiming land for Britain's first National Garden Festival site.
